CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Artworks Created stage positioned above or below the Institutionally Acquired stage?
SRP.A: The Artworks Created stage is positioned {above} the Institutionally Acquired stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Displayed in Exhibition?
VE.A: The value of stage Displayed in Exhibition is {26%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Shortlisted for Acquisition?
VE.A: The value of stage Shortlisted for Acquisition is {25%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Artworks Created?
VE.A: The value of stage Artworks Created is {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Artworks Created, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Institutionally Acquired, with a value of {12%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition is {15%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 83%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 25%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Eligible for Acquisition} stage has {15%}, the {Institutionally Acquired} stage has {12%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 25% and 33%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Displayed in Exhibition} stage has {26%}, the {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stage has {25%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Artworks Created to Submitted for Review, or from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Artworks Created} to {Submitted for Review} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, or from stage Eligible for Acquisition to Institutionally Acquired?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to {Displayed in Exhibition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition, from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, or from stage Eligible for Acquisition to Institutionally Acquired?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to stage {Displayed in Exhibition} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Artworks Created to Submitted for Review, from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition, or from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Artworks Created} to stage {Submitted for Review} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Artworks Created} and {Submitted for Review} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Displayed in Exhibition} and {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stages.
